channel.title: Help with 'for' loop

item.title: Help with 'for' loop
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

You’re coding JavaScript, and afaik, you can’t declare an integer with ‘int’, you’d have to use var

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 'for' loop
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

so

[code=javascript]var lost = [4, 8, 15, 16, 23, 42];
var count = lost.length;

var isLost = function (n) {
for (int i = 0; i < count; i++){ //line 5
if ( n === lost[i]) {
return true;
}
}
return false;
}[/code]

should work but the editor says "Error on line 5: Missing "

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 'for' loop
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

there must be three statements inside a for loop, usually its for (declaration; condition; increment), with that being said, you are missing a 3rd statement inside yours, which would be the increment statement for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)

edit: and that’s not java, it’s javascript

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I believe loops go like this

for(int i = 0; i < 30; i++) { //code }

item.title: Help with 'for' loop
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

I don’t think I completely understand how to use a for loop. If you could help I’m sure its very easy to fix.[code=java]var lost = [4, 8, 15, 16, 23, 42];
var count = lost.length;

var isLost = function (n) {
for (int i = 0; i < count){
if ( n === lost[i]) {
return true;
}
}
return false;
};

if ( isLost(12) ) {
console.log(‘12 is a lost number’);
}

if ( isLost(16) ) {
console.log(‘16 is a lost number’);
}[/code]

Read full topic
